pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
nouns which may take the genitive case particle 'no'

lessons.english: I'm getting a new house built.

lessons.japanese: 一体全体どうして新築した家を売ってしまったんですか。
lessons.english: Why on earth did you sell your newly-built house?

lessons.japanese: それらの新築の家はみな同じ高さである。
lessons.english: The new houses are of a uniform height.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは校舎新築の計画を立てた。
lessons.english: They formed a project to build a new school building.

lessons.japanese: 彼は新築の家に火災保険をかけた。
lessons.english: He insured his new house against fire.

lessons.japanese: 彼の概算によると家の新築費用は３０００万円です。
lessons.english: He estimates that the new house will cost roughly thirty million yen.

lessons.japanese: 息子に家を新築してあげた。
lessons.english: I built my son a new house.

lessons.japanese: 収入が増えるまでは、家を新築するなんて不可能だ。
lessons.english: It is out of the question for me to built a new house till my income becomes greater.

lessons.japanese: 私の家の前にビルが新築中です。
lessons.english: A new building is being built in front of my house.
I'm getting a new house built.

lessons.japanese: 一体全体どうして新築した家を売ってしまったんですか。
lessons.english: Why on earth did you sell your newly-built house?

lessons.japanese: それらの新築の家はみな同じ高さである。
lessons.english: The new houses are of a uniform height.

lessons.japanese: 私の家の前にビルが新築中です。
lessons.english: A new building is being built in front of my house.
